TestFindFile([methodName])

Test cases to thoroughly test absolute, relative, and flat filenames with PyreWall function privex.pyrewall.core.find_file()

TestPyreParser([methodName])

Unit testing which tests the output from parsing entire .pyre files by comparing the returned rules to expected result .v4 and .v6 files.

class tests.TestFindFile(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Test cases to thoroughly test absolute, relative, and flat filenames with PyreWall function privex.pyrewall.core.find_file()

Tests both the “search paths” functionality, along with the automatic extension guessing.

Dependant on the folder testdata which contains various empty files in a hierarchical structure designed for testing the search path functionality.

class tests.TestPyreParser(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Unit testing which tests the output from parsing entire .pyre files by comparing the returned rules to expected result .v4 and .v6 files.

Pyre testing configurations can be found in testdata/configs - Pyre configs generally end with .pyre, while the rendered outputs end in .v4 and .v6 respectively (unless they’re designed for testing an @import)

class tests.TestRuleHandlers(methodName='runTest')[source]¶
setUp()[source]¶

Hook method for setting up the test fixture before exercising it.

test_from_v4()[source]¶

Test that a rule with an IPv4 source address only returns a v4 rule

test_from_v6()[source]¶

Test that a rule with an IPv6 source address only returns a v6 rule

test_port_handler_multi()[source]¶

Test port rule parser with a multiple ports and port ranges

test_port_handler_single()[source]¶

Test port rule parser with a singular port

class tests.TestRuleValidation(methodName='runTest')[source]¶
test_invalid_port_negative()[source]¶

Test valid_port raises InvalidPort with negative port -1

test_invalid_port_overflow()[source]¶

Test valid_port raises InvalidPort with a too high port number (65537)

test_invalid_port_zero()[source]¶

Test valid_port raises InvalidPort with port 0

test_valid_port()[source]¶

Test privex.pyrewall.core.valid_port() with a valid string and integer
